These are a few things we are doing:Wash hands thoroughly for 30 seconds whenever practical, and always before eating. See https:/…when-how-handwashing.html or Google for advice.Eat outdoors, and ideally not too close to others (our favourite place is Mel's Diner in USS by the lake, we seldom have company). We don't like eating indoors anyway.Avoid long queues, eg at USS or ironically when buying masks. You're too close to the same people for an extended time.We're trying to spend as much time as possible in the open air, we'll do indoor things on another visit.Travel is difficult. Which is best, a slow lightly crowded bus, shorter time on the crowded MRT or a fast taxi, who has the air-con set to recycle the internal air, thus drying it and meaning the viruses can't be stopped by a mask? We are tending to use taxis, but no idea if this is good, but we note the authorities are urging taxis to open windows between customers.Get a good diet with fruit and vegetables, and stay active (it's more fun as well).One of the great things about being on holiday is that it does mean we're out and active every day.Edited: 10:34 am, February 10, 2020

The main difference between dengue and corona virus is that dengue transmitters (mosquitoes) can be generally visually seen, whereas corona virus carriers cannot be seen. It is relatively easier to protect yourselves from mosquitoes. Most of the hotels keep free from mosquitoes and so are the major tourist attractions. The places where tourists might catch dengue are fewer in number than those where residents may catch. Dengue is a bigger risk for residents than tourists.
